summary: An Ordinance authorizing and directing the City Comptroller to readvertise for sale negotiable bonds of The City of Seattle in the sum of One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) of bonds in the sum of Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000), voted at the general election held in The City of Seattle on the 8th day of March, 1910, under and pursuant to Ordinance No. 22732, approved December 14, 1909, and rejecting all bids therefor received on June 4, 1910, under a former advertisement made pursuant to Ordinance No. 23965, approved May 2, 1910, and declaring an emergency.
